Why do all the radio stations think we want to hear the news? Even LyricFM breaks for news. No news today, please. Or for the next 4 years.
@monicagtzwright Anyway, I'm making a genuine & conscious effort this year to listen to good people. Apologies if I have caused offence.
@monicagtzwright ... that the middleground and those on centre-left or centre-right can be drowned out by the extremes.
@monicagtzwright And that means taking each other in good faith. So many screaming liberals/ outright racist Trump supporters...
@monicagtzwright And good US citizens - Trump voters - probably are maddened that we don't get it. So we should try to understand each other
@monicagtzwright People in Ireland - good people, like you - struggle to understand how people could vote for Trump.
@monicagtzwright Twitter is a poor medium for conversation and nuance. But although US & Ireland speak same language, we're very different.
@monicagtzwright Sorry Monica, didn't mean to offend. Your biog suggests a very decent person, conservative leaning.
@monicagtzwright I'm probably leaning more left each day, but I think we know the other is not a monster. We can hopefully learn not fight!
@monicagtzwright I thought so. Might check in with over the next few years if that's ok? I promise to try and listen and learn, not judge.
@monicagtzwright +1. I always enjoy our talks. Makes me feel a conversation between conservatives & filthy liberals like me is possible! :)
@monicagtzwright But it is up to us (ie society) to teach young people - and everyone - what is and is not a reliable and fact-based source.
@monicagtzwright Not that I'm blaming readers! They can't - nor should be - expected to know how it works inside a paper.
@monicagtzwright Oh, it's happened to articles I have written. On many occasions. Only answer is more media & digital literacy in schools
@monicagtzwright Sorry, our last tweets crossed over. We agree on that one :)
@monicagtzwright Not sure that's fully true, even of Breitbart. I'd like to to think that, at least sometimes, they believe what they say.
@monicagtzwright @nytimes But yep, fair point on inaccuracies, though NYT inaccuracies tend to be occasional, as opposed to a business model
@monicagtzwright @nytimes As imperfect as much of the mainstream media - God knows, they're VERY far from perfect - they're no Breitbart
@monicagtzwright @nytimes Go after their advertisers then. Such is the free market ;)
